body:
So there are no info messages otherwise? Just when you enable `STTRACE`?
Are the symlinks synced across properly?

Confirm that the reproduction steps are as follows:
1. Have unix 2 devices syncing with each other
2. Open a test file with standard emacs
3. Wait for scan to complete
4. Close the file
Weird, sounds like it ought to be reproducible in a test. Will look at it!

Yes, I only get that message when I enable STTRACE. Re syncing: I just realised that the timestamps of these broken links are different on the various machines I'm looking at, so I suppose that the links are not properly synced in that sense. As a test I have just deleted one of the symlinks with a timestamp of 20:03 yesterday on a machine, and it came back a minute later with this morning's time (08:44).
Just removing a symlink and having that remove sync to the other side works fine for me, so there's something else going on here as well...

This worked for me to reproduce the problem:
1. Create a file 'test', wait for sync
2. Create symbolic link to it: ln -s test Test, wait for sync
3. Remove file 'test', wait for sync, symlink 'Test' is now broken on all machines
4. Removing broken symlink 'Test' on one machine doesn't trigger removal of file on other machines, but file magically re-appears upon sync
Do you have versioning enabled anywhere?
Yes, versioning is enabled on all participating nodes.
Versioning probably doesn't handle symlinks very well, but then I know what to investigate, thanks!
